documents.document: @jhwfung @mtnbvan @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver Any studies show the % of speculators in a market needed to create massive price inflation?
@jhwfung @mtnbvan @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver 60% of homes are SF, 80% households are owners. Lack of diversity is a concern as well.
@jhwfung @mtnbvan @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver ~200 multi-family completions per year for the past 6 years.
@jhwfung @mtnbvan @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver Less than 1000 purpose built rentals (as of 2015), but lots of secondary suites.
@jhwfung @mtnbvan @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver It's SFH, 40-50 yr old attached or nothing over here (outside of Lonsdale).
@jhwfung @mtnbvan @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver Seems like things are way different on your side of the bridge.
@mtnbvan instead of vs. how about &? @cameronmaltby @SteveSaretsky @ahvancouver @HALT_YVR
@cameronmaltby @SteveSaretsky I'm trying to evaluate the validity of the various arguments in #vanre. @ahvancouver & @HALT_YVR for example
@SteveSaretsky Thanks. So prices are falling for those who can afford high end, but not for those trying to get in the market (yet . . .)
@SteveSaretsky Or if any of the downward pressure on prices in SFH will show up in townhomes and apartments?
@SteveSaretsky Any thoughts on whether high end market will just correct 15% downward to adjust for the tax, then continue chugging along?

@michaelgeller ask for the beer and deep fried pickle deal. $8
@CBCStephenQuinn Thanks a lot. I'm sure it's a challenge to get the right balance in a 30s clip. @nsscbc is hoping for an open discussion
@CBCStephenQuinn Interview was balanced, news highlights at 430 mentioned cyclists only. Cyclists aren't driving this discussion.
@CBCStephenQuinn Hmm, only heard "reduce speed limits for cyclist safety" as the intro to the clip.
It's about safe streets for all when not in a motor vehicle. Kids & seniors too! https://t.co/sgy8io76QR @CBCOnTheCoast @CBCStephenQuinn
Is @CBCOnTheCoast casting #SlowDownNorthShore forum as a cyclist issue for #clickbait, or is it just an oversight? @CBCStephenQuinn
@MECraver Online invite mentions vulnerable road users (people waking and biking). Maybe you got a different invite? https://t.co/sgy8io76QR
@martynschmoll asked "Why?" to those who said "Bad idea" on FB. Yes @MECraver, I like when opinions that conflict with facts are questioned.
@BrentRichter @NorthShoreNews Kudos to @martynschmoll for trying to open up a discussion.
@AntjeWahl Also, if two units per single family lot, what about duplex and other housing forms?
@AntjeWahl Discussing Secondary suites should be interesting. Thoughts on how suites impact 75%-90% goal for new units in town centres?
@AntjeWahl There's a review on single family as well, I'll check if secondary suites are included.
@AntjeWahl Coach house review is coming up, this input would be valuable.
@AntjeWahl @pladner ~5800 renter households in #northvan district. ~1000 purpose built apt, ~4200 secondary suites. https://t.co/RTMzOJ3IIv
@vanpdf @WayneFougere @GRIDSVancouver Or downzone everything and allow incremental density by right . . . https://t.co/0NjDLDaPVJ
@BrentRichter Fully support this. I think life, health and well being have far greater value than convenience.
Increasing land values impact the viability of older rental buildings. Old rental = more affordable rental? Discussâ€¦ https://t.co/TkaeHHmB2M

@jimusser @PJNewWest Ok. What's the buy in?

@AntjeWahl I have some more reading to do on alternative tax strategies for funding local government services.
@guytro @YVR_P @guytro @YVR_P Note: 22% of homes in #northvan district owned & occupied mortgage free by seniors. https://t.co/X8gqVi8qak
@guytro With the tax deferral program, the "forced out" argument doesn't make sense to me. Maybe there's another point of view?

@NanaimoCommons We do it different. At public input, people speak, council listens. Council debates with council, not public.
@NanaimoCommons That's a different approach to public input.
Read this article and let me know if you see a parallel to the current narrative in #northvan. https://t.co/uNp2EeZtQv
@NorthVanMike that's the info we received last night. I'll double check. Huge local variability of rainfall totals in #northvan
@Crof @JessLStanley @NVanDistrict Expecting a lot of surface runoff due to ice, snow and frozen ground at all elevations.

@CanNationalPoli @GregMooredotca @poco_IDEA ~34K families in MetroVan pay more than half their income for rent https://t.co/JD9kOMuP40
@GregMooredotca @poco_IDEA Rent? Make more than $35K? Have family, kids? Sorry, no help for you.
@GregMooredotca @poco_IDEA Owner of $1.5M property, making $200K, no kids? $570 subsidy.
@GregMooredotca @poco_IDEA For example: single parent, 1 child, earning $34K a year, paying $1400 in rent could receive $960 housing subsidy
@GregMooredotca @poco_IDEA Using property value to determine the distribution of government subsidies for housing isn't fair or equitable.
@SteveSaretsky any data to suggest shift in demand & substitution versus reduction in demand?
3 spoke to budget last night. We might need better promotion. Something like this? #northvan https://t.co/XsrwDEsW3X

and solves your problem before the next days commute! 2/2 @5kids1condo @TransLink
@5kids1condo Have to commend @TransLink ^LA for excellent customer service. Who else responds within minutes to Twitter mentions 1/2
@5kids1condo @TransLink On second assessment, the old commute still works! Trip planner has hard time computing route with 4 transfers.
@YVRHousing How do we apply for the homerenter grant?
@5kids1condo @TransLink No luck. Going to need to figure out a new commute. 1hr 45min not tolerable.
@CanSpice I'm sure the Evergreen Line made 99.99% of people's transit commutes faster, except for me and maybe @mikebuda . . .
@graeme_0 Lougheed and Schoolhouse. It's a 75 minute ride in the summer (60 on an e-bike). Too long to bike consistently with my schedule
@TransLink Thanks for the quick response. I used Google schedule explorer. I can try customer service but I think I'm out of luck.
Or find a new home, find a new job, or spend ~$10K a year on a second vehicle that I''d rather spend on something else 4/2
To keep previous active commute time, have to bike to #Phibbs from #lynnvalley, lug bike on bus/train, bike last mile from Braid to work 3/2
#northvan to #coquitlam was 3 xfers. Adding 4th at Production Way messed it up. One of the few negatively impacted by the change I guess 2/2
Hmm, just found out that @TransLink Evergreen Line changes turned my 60-75 min 1-way commute into 95-120 min. (1/2)
